intro: Calceolaria botterii, commonly known as the Botter's slipper orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant belongs to the family Calceolariaceae and is known for its delicate, hairy leaves and compact growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Calceolaria botterii is considered a rare and endangered species.
